short_description: This function infers the topic distribution for the input.
long_description: This function is used to output the topic distribution for each document in inputtable. Inputtable contains the documents to be infered and the  modeltable is the output of LdaTrainer. The result is stored in outputtable.

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queenâ€™s IP saddress or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: InputTable
argument_clauses.description: The name for the input relation. It should be a table or a view. Each row of the relation consists of document id, the word and optional the word count.

argument_clauses.name: ModelTable
argument_clauses.description: The name of the input table for the relation between the topics and words. This table should be generated by ldaTrainer.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTable
argument_clauses.description: The name of the output table for the topic distribution of each document in inputtable. This table must not exist.

argument_clauses.name: DocIdColumn
argument_clauses.description: The column identify different documents. Input columns must contain integer SQL types. Input columns must contain string SQL types. Input columns can be the following SQL types: [numeric, uuid, bytea].

argument_clauses.name: WordColumn
argument_clauses.description: The column contains the words. Input columns must contain integer SQL types. Input columns must contain string SQL types.

argument_clauses.name: CountColumn
argument_clauses.description: The column contains the count of corresponding word in the row. If specified, it should be of type numeric. If not specified, each row will be associated with a count value 1. Input columns must contain numeric SQL types.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTopicNum
argument_clauses.description: Specifies how many top weighted topics will be output for each document. It is a positive integer number or per-defined string "all". If "all" is given, all the topics and corresponding weight will be outputted for each input document.  The default value is all.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTopicWordNum
argument_clauses.description: Specifies how many top topic words should be outputted in the output table accompany with the corresponding topic id. It is a positive integer number or per-defined string "all", "none". If "none" is given, none of the topic words will be outputted. If "all" is given, the function will emit all related topic words corresponding to each outputted topicid. The default value is none.
